授業目的:
This course provides students with basic concepts and awareness in the management of technological innovation as well as an understanding of the challenges and opportunities both small and larger enterprises face in this regard. The course takes an integrated approach to learning about technological innovation in relation to technological development. It covers three main areas:
(1) innovation management;
(2) turning technology into business; and
(3) new product development."
到達目標:
After completing the course, students should be able to:
(1) integrate systematically, knowledge and understanding of different aspects of innovation and its role in business and society;
(2) review critically current research and developments in innovation management;
(3) apply innovation-related theories in different settings in order to generate new approaches to innovation;
(4) identify, evaluate, and suggest solutions to challenges in large and small enterprises relating to innovative performance;
(5) demonstrate awareness of sustainability aspects of innovation;
(6) assess the personal need for further knowledge and take responsibility for his/her own learning; and
(7) communicate central concepts for the course in English, both orally and in writing."
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法:
Face to face format.
Lecture, presentation, and discussion. Each lecture will be interactive. Students are encouraged to participate actively in discussions during the lecture and Q&A sessions. Students are required to make an in-class presentation on an assigned, short case study given one week's preparation time.

第1回: Innovation management: South Korea vs. Turkey -- Lessons for Viet Nam?
第12回: Market research and its influence on new product development

教科書/Required texts1: Innovation Management and New Product Development, 6th edition
評価.教科書Required texts0: Paul Trott, Innovation Management and New Product Development, 6th edition, Pearson, 2017.
